alert.note: Alert for Bay; Calhoun (Florida) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued December 10 at 8:33AM EST by NWS Tallahassee
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 930 AM CST /1030 AM EST/ THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...Portions of Big Bend and Panhandle Florida, including the following counties, in Big Bend Florida, Liberty. In Panhandle Florida, Bay, Calhoun and Gulf. * WHEN...Until 930 AM CST /1030 AM EST/. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Water over roadways. Overflowing poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 733 AM CST /833 AM EST/, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 2 and 3 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts up to 2 inches are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Stonemill Creek, Wewahitchka, Orange, Chipola Park, Chipola Cutoff, Kinard, Honeyville, Scotts Ferry, Red Hill, Lewis, Marysville, Estiffanulga and Overstreet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
